content: Singaporean parliamentary meeting The **7th Parliament of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Its first session commenced on 9 January 1989 and was prorogued on 21 April 1990. Its second session commenced on 7 June 1990 and was [prorogued](/wiki/Prorogued) on 29 January 1991. It commenced its third session on 22 February 1991 and was dissolved on 14 August 1991. The members of the 7th Parliament were elected in the [1988 general election](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election). Parliament was controlled by a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) majority, led by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) who subsequently handed over to [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong). The Speaker was [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon). The *de facto* [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)) was [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) of the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party). At about two years and seven months, this Parliament had the shortest tenure in Singapore's history and the only one as of 2025 to have three sessions. ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** - [Lim Boon Heng](/wiki/Lim_Boon_Heng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 16 January 1989 - [Abdullah Tarmugi](/wiki/Abdullah_Tarmugi) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 16 January 1989 - **[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore):** - [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), until 28 November 1990 - [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 28 November 1990 - [**Deputy Prime Minister**](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)**:** - [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), until 28 November 1990 - [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 28 November 1990 - [**Leader of the Opposition**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore))**:** [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) ([SDP](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)) - [**Leader of the House**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_(Singapore)): [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Party Whip of the People's Action Party](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party)**: [Lee Boon Yang](/wiki/Lee_Boon_Yang) - [**Deputy Party Whip of the People's Action Party**](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party#List_of_deputy_party_whips)**:** [Ho Kah Leong](/wiki/Ho_Kah_Leong) ## Composition PartyMembersAt
